intro: Psoralea patens, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has a creeping or ascending growth habit, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Psoralea patens is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
